35. Solver¶

class optcom.solvers.solver.Solver(f, method='euler')¶
Parameters

  • f (AbstractEquation) -- The function to compute.

  • method (str) -- The computation method.

static euler(f, vectors, h, z)¶

Euler method to solve system of differential equations.

Parameters

  • f (AbstractEquation) -- The functions which compute each equation of the system.

  • vectors (Array) -- The value of the unknown (waves) at the considered time/space step.

  • h (float) -- The step size.

  • z (float) -- The current value of the variable.

Return type

Array

Returns

The one step euler computation results.

Notes

Having the initial system of differential equations:

\[\begin{split}\begin{cases} x'(t) = f(t, x, y, z), \quad x(t_0) = x_0 \\ y'(t) = f(t, x, y, z), \quad y(t_0) = y_0 \\ z'(t) = f(t, x, y, z), \quad z(t_0) = z_0 \\ \ldots \\ \end{cases}\end{split}\]

The Euler method solves it by the following iterative method:

\[\begin{split}\begin{cases} x_{k+1} = x_{k} + hf(t_k, x_k, y_k, z_k)\\ y_{k+1} = y_{k} + hf(t_k, x_{k+1}, y_k, z_k)\\ z_{k+1} = z_{k} + hf(t_k, x_{k+1}, y_{k+1}, z_k) \\ \ldots \\ \end{cases}\end{split}\]
static f_call(f, vectors, h, z)¶

Call the __call__ method of the equation f.

Return type

Array

static ssfm(f, waves, h, z)¶

Split step Fourier method.

Parameters

  • f (AbstractEquation) -- The function to compute.

  • waves (Array) -- The value of the unknown (waves) at the considered space step.

  • h (float) -- The step size.

  • z (float) -- The current value of the space variable.

Return type

Array

Returns

The one step euler computation results.

Notes

Having the initial system of differential equations:

\[\begin{split}\begin{alignat}{1} A^{L} &= \mathcal{F}^{-1}\big\{\exp \big(h\hat\mathcal{{D}}\big)\mathcal{F}\{A(z,T)\} \big\}\\ A(z+h,T) &= \exp\big(h\hat\mathcal{{N}}(A(z,T)) \big)A^{L} \end{alignat}\end{split}\]

for \(j = 1, \ldots, K\) where \(K\) is the number of channels.

static ssfm_opti_reduced(f, waves, h, z)¶

Optimized reduced split step Fourier method.

Parameters

  • f (AbstractEquation) -- The function to compute.

  • waves (Array) -- The value of the unknown (waves) at the considered space step.

  • h (float) -- The step size.

  • z (float) -- The current value of the space variable.

Return type

Array

Returns

The one step euler computation results.

Notes

Having the initial system of differential equations:

\[\begin{split}\begin{alignat}{1} A_j^{L} &= \mathcal{F}^{-1}\Big\{\exp\Big(\frac{h}{2} \hat\mathcal{{D}}\Big)\mathcal{F}\{A_j(z)\}\Big\}\\ A_j^{N} &= \exp\Big(h\hat\mathcal{{N}}\big(A_1^{N}, \ldots, A_{j-1}^{N}, A_{j}^{L}, \ldots, A_K^{L}\big)\Big) A_j^{L}\\ A_j(z+h) &= \mathcal{F}^{-1}\Big\{\exp\Big(\frac{h}{2} \hat\mathcal{{D}}\Big)\mathcal{F}\{A_j^{N}\}\Big\} \end{alignat}\end{split}\]

for \(j = 1, \ldots, K\) where \(K\) is the number of channels.

static ssfm_opti_super_sym(f, waves, h, z)¶

Optimized super symmetric split step Fourier method.

Parameters

  • f (AbstractEquation) -- The function to compute.

  • waves (Array) -- The value of the unknown (waves) at the considered space step.

  • h (float) -- The step size.

  • z (float) -- The current value of the space variable.

Return type

Array

Returns

The one step euler computation results.

Notes

Having the initial system of differential equations:

\[\begin{split}\begin{alignat}{1} A_j^{L} &= \mathcal{F}^{-1}\Big\{\exp\Big(\frac{h}{2} \hat\mathcal{{D}}\Big)\mathcal{F}\{A_j(z)\}\Big\}\\ A_j^{N'} &= \exp\Big(\frac{h}{2}\hat\mathcal{{N}} \big(A_1^{N'}, \ldots, A_{j-1}^{N'}, A_{j}^{L}, \ldots, A_K^{L}\big)\Big) A_j^{L}\\ A_i^{N} &= \exp\Big(\frac{h}{2}\hat\mathcal{{N}} \big(A_1^{N'}, \ldots, A_{i}^{N'}, A_{i+1}^{N}, \ldots, A_K^{N}\big)\Big) A_j^{L} \\ A_j(z+h) &= \mathcal{F}^{-1}\Big\{\exp\Big(\frac{h}{2} \hat\mathcal{{D}}\Big)\mathcal{F}\{A_j^{N}\}\Big\} \end{alignat}\end{split}\]

for \(j = 1, \ldots, K\) and \(i = K, \ldots, 1\) where \(K\) is the number of channels.

static ssfm_reduced(f, waves, h, z)¶

Reduced split step Fourier method.

Parameters

  • f (AbstractEquation) -- The function to compute.

  • waves (Array) -- The value of the unknown (waves) at the considered space step.

  • h (float) -- The step size.

  • z (float) -- The current value of the space variable.

Return type

Array

Returns

The one step euler computation results.

Notes

Having the initial system of differential equations:

\[\begin{split}\begin{alignat}{1} A^{L} &= \mathcal{F}^{-1}\Big\{\exp\Big(\frac{h}{2} \hat\mathcal{{D}}\Big)\mathcal{F}\{A(z,T)\}\Big\}\\ A^{N} &= \exp\big(h\hat\mathcal{{N}}(A^{L})\big) A^{L}\\ A(z+h,T) &= \mathcal{F}^{-1}\Big\{\exp\Big(\frac{h}{2} \hat\mathcal{{D}}\Big)\mathcal{F}\{A^{N}\}\Big\} \end{alignat}\end{split}\]

for \(j = 1, \ldots, K\) where \(K\) is the number of channels.

static ssfm_super_sym(f, waves, h, z)¶

Super symmetric split step Fourier method.

Parameters

  • f (AbstractEquation) -- The function to compute.

  • waves (Array) -- The value of the unknown (waves) at the considered space step.

  • h (float) -- The step size.

  • z (float) -- The current value of the space variable.

Return type

Array

Returns

The one step euler computation results.

Notes

Having the initial system of differential equations:

\[\begin{split}\begin{alignat}{1} A_j^{L} &= \mathcal{F}^{-1}\Big\{\exp\Big(\frac{h}{2} \hat\mathcal{{D}}\Big)\mathcal{F}\{A_j(z)\}\Big\}\\ A_j^{N'} &= \exp\Big(\frac{h}{2}\hat\mathcal{{N}} \big(A_1^{L}, \ldots, A_K^{L}\big)\Big) A_j^{L}\\ A_i^{N} &= \exp\Big(\frac{h}{2}\hat\mathcal{{N}} \big(A_1^{N'}, \ldots, A_{i}^{N}, A_{i+1}^{N}, \ldots, A_K^{N}\big)\Big) A_j^{L}\\ A_j(z+h) &= \mathcal{F}^{-1}\Big\{\exp\Big(\frac{h}{2} \hat\mathcal{{D}}\Big)\mathcal{F}\{A_j^{N}\}\Big\} \end{alignat}\end{split}\]

for \(j = 1, \ldots, K\) and \(i = K, \ldots, 1\) where \(K\) is the number of channels.

static ssfm_symmetric(f, waves, h, z)¶

Symmetric split step Fourier method.

Parameters

  • f (AbstractEquation) -- The function to compute.

  • waves (Array) -- The value of the unknown (waves) at the considered space step.

  • h (float) -- The step size.

  • z (float) -- The current value of the space variable.

Return type

Array

Returns

The one step euler computation results.

Notes

Having the initial system of differential equations:

\[\begin{split}\begin{alignat}{1} A_j^{L} &= \mathcal{F}^{-1}\Big\{\exp\Big(\frac{h}{2} \hat\mathcal{{D}}\Big)\mathcal{F}\{A_j(z)\}\Big\}\\ A_j^{N} &= \exp\Big(h\hat\mathcal{{N}} \big(A_1(z), \ldots, A_K(z)\big)\Big) A_j^{L}\\ A_j(z+h) &= \mathcal{F}^{-1}\Big\{\exp\Big(\frac{h}{2} \hat\mathcal{{D}}\Big)\mathcal{F}\{A_j^{N}\}\Big\} \end{alignat}\end{split}\]

for \(j = 1, \ldots, K\) where \(K\) is the number of channels.

36. Stepper¶

class optcom.solvers.stepper.Stepper(eqs, method=['euler'], length=1.0, steps=[100], step_method=['fixed'], solver_order='following', stepper_method=['forward'], solver_sequence=None, error=0.01, save_all=False)¶
Parameters

  • eqs (list of AbstractEquation) -- The equation to solve.

  • method (List[str]) -- The method used to solve the equation.

  • length (float) -- The length over which the equation is considered. \([km]\)

  • steps (List[int]) -- The number of steps used for the computation.

  • step_method (List[str]) -- The method used to update the step size.

  • solver_order (str) -- The order type in which the methods will be computed. (will be ignored if solver_sequence is provided)

  • stepper_method (List[str]) -- The method used to converge to solution.

  • solver_sequence (Optional[List[int]]) -- The sequence in which the methods will be computed.

  • error (float) -- The error for convergence criterion of stepper resolution.

  • save_all (bool) -- If True, will save all channels of all fields at each space step during the equation resolution. The number of step recorded depends on the memory_storage attribute of layout.Layout. The recorded channels can be accessed with the attribute storage.

start_shooting_backward()¶

Set parameters to start the shooting method with backward pass.

start_shooting_forward()¶

Set parameters to start the shooting method with forward pass.
